meanings.definition: The territory or jurisdiction of a lord or feudal superior.
meanings.sent1: The signiory of the lord extended over the entire village.
meanings.sent2: The signiory was passed down through generations in the noble family.
meanings.sent3: The signiory of the lord was so vast, even the neighboring lords were envious.
meanings.sent4: Her influence in the company was like a signiory, commanding respect and authority.
meanings.sent5: The signiory of the castle was marked by the towering walls and grand gates.

meanings.definition: The rank or dignity of a lord or feudal superior.
meanings.sent1: He carried himself with the signiory befitting a nobleman.
meanings.sent2: The signiory of the baron was evident in his regal attire.
meanings.sent3: The signiory of the king's advisor was evident in his confident demeanor.
meanings.sent4: Her signiory among her peers was akin to a crown of respect.
meanings.sent5: The signiory of the knight shone through his brave actions on the battlefield.

meanings.definition: The office or position of a lord or feudal superior.
meanings.sent1: The signiory of the lord required him to oversee the estate's affairs.
meanings.sent2: She aspired to attain the signiory of the castle's steward.
meanings.sent3: The signiory of the duke came with a heavy burden of responsibilities.
meanings.sent4: His signiory as the chief magistrate was respected by all in the town.
meanings.sent5: The signiory of the queen's advisor was a position of great influence.
